cwe_description: A buffer overflow occurs when a program attempts to write data beyond the allocated boundary of a buffer. This can lead to memory corruption, crashes, or arbitrary code execution.
explanation: The code uses `av_dict_set` to set metadata values without checking the length of the value being set. Specifically, `material_package->name` is used directly as the value for "material_package_name" without any bounds checking. If `material_package->name` is excessively long, it can lead to a buffer overflow in the metadata dictionary.
